pr_title: [BEAM-11408] Integrate BigQuery sink streaming inserts with GroupIntoBatches

timeline.message: Integrate BQ streaming inserts with GroupIntoBatches

timeline.bodyText:
Didn't add a global window around here as the existing implementation:

  
    
      beam/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigquery/StreamingWriteTables.java
    
    
         Line 281
      in
      2462fe9
    
    
    
    

        
          
           "GlobalWindow", 
        
    
  


According to the documentation the global window is for correct access to side inputs but it seems to me that up to this point the dynamic destination has been read. @reuvenlax I might be missing something but let me know if I should keep the global window (and if so where?).
timeline.author: nehsyc

replies.bodyText: Hmm good question. I wonder if someone refactored the code at some point to change things? I'm not entirely sure about the global window here.
replies.author: reuvenlax

replies.bodyText: However we probably want to put in global window here anyway as the GroupIntoBatches should logically be in hte global window, right? If the user had tiny windows, we don't want that to result in tiny grouping.
replies.author: reuvenlax

replies.bodyText: Good point! I added a global window right before GroupIntoBatches.
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.message: Integrate BQ streaming inserts with GroupIntoBatches

timeline.bodyText: Not sure about this limit. What would be a proper value? Should we make it configurable?
timeline.author: nehsyc

replies.bodyText: to be hones, I am not sure what's a good duration either. I think this is acceptable for now, until we find out more. Thoughts?
replies.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: Yeah sounds reasonable to proceed with this for now.
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.bodyText: I would make this specified in the BigQueryIO builder instead.
timeline.author: reuvenlax

timeline.bodyText: I think this should be an option on BigQueryIO.
timeline.author: reuvenlax

replies.bodyText: I was thinking that adding the option to BigQueryOptions might be easier for the users to switch on/off the feature. If it is an option of BigQueryIO users would need to update their code (vs. adding a flag) right? It might not be a concern...
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.author: reuvenlax

timeline.bodyText: seems more direct to just call tableRows.computeIfAbsent(tableSpec, ...)
timeline.author: reuvenlax

timeline.bodyText: instead add an OutputReceiver parameter to finishBundle.
timeline.author: reuvenlax

replies.bodyText: finishBundle doesn't seems to accept parameters other than FinishBundleContext.
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.author: reuvenlax

replies.bodyText: Because input is batched through a stateful DoFn, GroupIntoBatches. Any suggestion on the name?
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.bodyText: We are relying on the fact that the GroupIntoBatches produces stable output. Really we should tag this with RequiresStableInput. Can you find out if this is safe to do in Dataflow?
timeline.author: reuvenlax

replies.bodyText:
There is a transform override in Dataflow to add a preceding Reshuffle to DoFns marked with RequiresStableInput.

  
    
      beam/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/RequiresStableInputParDoOverrides.java
    
    
         Line 73
      in
      74ec609
    
    
    
    

        
          
           .apply("Materialize input", Reshuffle.viaRandomKey()) 
        
    
  


The override is disabled though. So I guess currently Dataflow does nothing for this tag.

  
    
      beam/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/DataflowRunner.java
    
    
         Line 601
      in
      df74d74
    
    
    
    

        
          
           /* TODO[Beam-4684]: Support @RequiresStableInput on Dataflow in a more intelligent way 
        
    
  


Also my understanding is that dding a Reshuffle before GroupIntoBatches will introduce an extra shuffle as Reshuffle is essentially a GBK + value expansion in Dataflow.
replies.author: nehsyc

timeline.author: reuvenlax

timeline.message: Moved autosharding option from BigQueryOption to BigQueryIOBuilder; addressed comments.
Moved autosharding option from BigQueryOption to BigQueryIOBuilder; addressed comments.
Integrate BQ streaming inserts with GroupIntoBatches
Moved autosharding option from BigQueryOption to BigQueryIOBuilder; addressed comments.
Revert the logic that was dropped during merge
